description: This course covers multidisciplinary perspectives, particularly criminological theories to indentify the contexts, origins, causes and explanations of international terrorism; the sociological environment that sustains and reduces the incidence of terrorism. Students examine comparative counter terrorism strategies derived from criminological theories
name: TERRORISM- CRIMINOLOGICAL EXPLANATIONS AND STRATEGIC RESPONSES

section.name: TERRORISM- CRIMINOLOGICAL EXPLANATIONS AND STRATEGIC RESPONSES

values.name: TERRORISM- CRIMINOLOGICAL EXPLANATIONS AND STRATEGIC RESPONSES
